1â†’# Tasks: Stage 0 Capability Extension
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/038-stage0-extend/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: TDD is REQUIRED per Constitution Check (Principle VII). Tests MUST be written first and FAIL before implementation.
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’## Path Conventions
    17â†’
    18â†’- **Single project**: `src/`, `tests/`, `build/` at repository root
    19â†’- Paths use absolute paths from repository root
    20â†’
    21â†’---
    22â†’
    23â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
    24â†’
    25â†’**Purpose**: Project initialization and shared test infrastructure
    26â†’
    27â†’- [ ] T001 Create test directory structure for new tests in tests/unit/, tests/contract/, tests/integration/
    28â†’- [ ] T002 [P] Add test file stubs for defconstant-test.lisp in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    29â†’- [ ] T003 [P] Add test file stubs for declare-skip-test.lisp in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
    30â†’- [ ] T004 [P] Add test file stubs for defstruct-expand-test.lisp in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
    31â†’- [ ] T005 [P] Add test file stub for stage0-extend-test.lisp in tests/contract/stage0-extend-test.lisp
    32â†’- [ ] T006 Verify test runner can load all new test files via (asdf:test-system :clysm)
    33â†’
    34â†’---
    35â†’
    36â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    37â†’
    38â†’**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    39â†’
    40â†’**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete
    41â†’
    42â†’- [ ] T007 Add constant-registry hash-table initialization to build/bootstrap.lisp
    43â†’- [ ] T008 Implement register-constant function in build/bootstrap.lisp
    44â†’- [ ] T009 Implement lookup-constant function in build/bootstrap.lisp
    45â†’- [ ] T010 Implement constant-defined-p function in build/bootstrap.lisp
    46â†’- [ ] T011 Add defconstant to compilable-form-p acceptance list in build/bootstrap.lisp
    47â†’- [ ] T012 Export new AST symbols (ast-defconstant, filter-declare-forms) from src/clysm/package.lisp
    48â†’
    49â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    50â†’
    51â†’---
    52â†’
    53â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Compile Constant Definitions (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP
    54â†’
    55â†’**Goal**: defconstant and defparameter forms compile to Wasm globals with constant folding
    56â†’
    57â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(defconstant +test+ 42)` and verify Wasm output contains a global with value 42
    58â†’
    59â†’### Tests for User Story 1 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)
    60â†’
    61â†’- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Write unit test for ast-defconstant struct creation in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    62â†’- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Write unit test for parse-defconstant-form in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    63â†’- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Write unit test for simple defconstant with literal value in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    64â†’- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Write unit test for defconstant with arithmetic expression in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    65â†’- [ ] T017 [P] [US1] Write unit test for defconstant referencing another constant in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    66â†’- [ ] T018 [P] [US1] Write unit test for defparameter mutable global in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
    67â†’- [ ] T019 [US1] Verify all US1 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)
    68â†’
    69â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    70â†’
    71â†’- [ ] T020 [US1] Add ast-defconstant struct definition (mirroring ast-defparameter) in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
    72â†’- [ ] T021 [US1] Add parse-defconstant-form function in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
    73â†’- [ ] T022 [US1] Add defconstant case to parse-form dispatcher in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
    74â†’- [ ] T023 [US1] Implement fold-constant-expression for arithmetic (+, -, *, /) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    75â†’- [ ] T024 [US1] Implement fold-constant-expression for constant references in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    76â†’- [ ] T025 [US1] Implement compile-defconstant (immutable global) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    77â†’- [ ] T026 [US1] Add defconstant case to compile-form dispatcher in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
    78â†’- [ ] T027 [US1] Verify all US1 tests PASS (green phase)
    79â†’- [ ] T028 [US1] Run wasm-tools validate on output with defconstant forms
    80â†’
    81â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - defconstant/defparameter compilation works independently
    82â†’
    83â†’---
    84â†’
    85â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Compile Condition Definitions (Priority: P2)
    86â†’
    87â†’**Goal**: define-condition forms expand to defclass and compile successfully
    88â†’
    89â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(define-condition my-error (error) ())` and verify defclass output
    90â†’
    91â†’### Tests for User Story 2 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)
    92â†’
    93â†’- [ ] T029 [P] [US2] Write unit test for expand-define-condition basic case in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
    94â†’- [ ] T030 [P] [US2] Write unit test for define-condition with slots in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
    95â†’- [ ] T031 [P] [US2] Write unit test for define-condition with :report option (skipped) in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
    96â†’- [ ] T032 [P] [US2] Write unit test for nested condition inheritance in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
    97â†’- [ ] T033 [US2] Verify all US2 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)
    98â†’
    99â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
   100â†’
   101â†’- [ ] T034 [US2] Implement expand-define-condition function in build/bootstrap.lisp
   102â†’- [ ] T035 [US2] Handle slot specifications with :initarg and :reader options in build/bootstrap.lisp
   103â†’- [ ] T036 [US2] Handle :report option by recording but not compiling in build/bootstrap.lisp
   104â†’- [ ] T037 [US2] Add define-condition expansion to expand-form-recursive in build/bootstrap.lisp
   105â†’- [ ] T038 [US2] Verify all US2 tests PASS (green phase)
   106â†’- [ ] T039 [US2] Run wasm-tools validate on output with define-condition forms
   107â†’
   108â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 complete - define-condition expansion works independently
   109â†’
   110â†’---
   111â†’
   112â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Handle Declaration Forms (Priority: P2)
   113â†’
   114â†’**Goal**: declare forms are skipped without causing compilation failure
   115â†’
   116â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(defun foo (x) (declare (type fixnum x)) (+ x 1))` successfully
   117â†’
   118â†’### Tests for User Story 3 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)
   119â†’
   120â†’- [ ] T040 [P] [US3] Write unit test for filter-declare-forms function in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
   121â†’- [ ] T041 [P] [US3] Write unit test for defun with single declare in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
   122â†’- [ ] T042 [P] [US3] Write unit test for defun with multiple declare forms in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
   123â†’- [ ] T043 [P] [US3] Write unit test for let with declare in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
   124â†’- [ ] T044 [P] [US3] Write unit test for proclaim at top level (skipped) in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
   125â†’- [ ] T045 [US3] Verify all US3 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)
   126â†’
   127â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   128â†’
   129â†’- [ ] T046 [US3] Implement filter-declare-forms function in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   130â†’- [ ] T047 [US3] Integrate filter-declare-forms into parse-defun-form in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   131â†’- [ ] T048 [US3] Integrate filter-declare-forms into parse-let-form in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   132â†’- [ ] T049 [US3] Integrate filter-declare-forms into parse-lambda-form in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
   133â†’- [ ] T050 [US3] Add proclaim to skip list in bootstrap.lisp compilable-form-p in build/bootstrap.lisp
   134â†’- [ ] T051 [US3] Verify all US3 tests PASS (green phase)
   135â†’- [ ] T052 [US3] Run wasm-tools validate on output with declare-containing functions
   136â†’
   137â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - declaration handling works independently
   138â†’
   139â†’---
   140â†’
   141â†’## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Enhanced Error Reporting (Priority: P3)
   142â†’
   143â†’**Goal**: Operator-grouped failure statistics with percentage progress
   144â†’
   145â†’**Independent Test**: Run bootstrap with known-unsupported forms and verify grouped error output
   146â†’
   147â†’### Tests for User Story 4 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)
   148â†’
   149â†’- [ ] T053 [P] [US4] Write unit test for record-failure function in tests/unit/error-report-test.lisp
   150â†’- [ ] T054 [P] [US4] Write unit test for operator-failures hash-table tracking in tests/unit/error-report-test.lisp
   151â†’- [ ] T055 [P] [US4] Write unit test for generate-failure-report format in tests/unit/error-report-test.lisp
   152â†’- [ ] T056 [P] [US4] Write unit test for percentage calculation in tests/unit/error-report-test.lisp
   153â†’- [ ] T057 [US4] Verify all US4 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)
   154â†’
   155â†’### Implementation for User Story 4
   156â†’
   157â†’- [ ] T058 [US4] Add operator-failures and operator-examples fields to compile-result struct in build/bootstrap.lisp
   158â†’- [ ] T059 [US4] Implement record-failure function with operator tracking in build/bootstrap.lisp
   159â†’- [ ] T060 [US4] Integrate record-failure into compile-all-forms error handling in build/bootstrap.lisp
   160â†’- [ ] T061 [US4] Implement generate-failure-report with grouped output in build/bootstrap.lisp
   161â†’- [ ] T062 [US4] Add percentage calculation to bootstrap output in build/bootstrap.lisp
   162â†’- [ ] T063 [US4] Verify all US4 tests PASS (green phase)
   163â†’
   164â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - error reporting works independently
   165â†’
   166â†’---
   167â†’
   168â†’## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Handle defstruct via Expansion (Priority: P3)
   169â†’
   170â†’**Goal**: defstruct forms expand to constructor and accessor defuns
   171â†’
   172â†’**Independent Test**: Compile `(defstruct point x y)` and verify make-point, point-x, point-y functions
   173â†’
   174â†’### Tests for User Story 5 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)
   175â†’
   176â†’- [ ] T064 [P] [US5] Write unit test for expand-defstruct basic case in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
   177â†’- [ ] T065 [P] [US5] Write unit test for defstruct with slot defaults in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
   178â†’- [ ] T066 [P] [US5] Write unit test for defstruct with :constructor option in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
   179â†’- [ ] T067 [P] [US5] Write unit test for defstruct accessor generation in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
   180â†’- [ ] T068 [P] [US5] Write unit test for defstruct predicate generation in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
   181â†’- [ ] T069 [US5] Verify all US5 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)
   182â†’
   183â†’### Implementation for User Story 5
   184â†’
   185â†’- [ ] T070 [US5] Implement expand-defstruct for basic struct with slots in build/bootstrap.lisp
   186â†’- [ ] T071 [US5] Generate make-NAME constructor with &key parameters in build/bootstrap.lisp
   187â†’- [ ] T072 [US5] Generate NAME-SLOT accessor functions in build/bootstrap.lisp
   188â†’- [ ] T073 [US5] Generate NAME-p predicate function in build/bootstrap.lisp
   189â†’- [ ] T074 [US5] Handle slot defaults in constructor parameters in build/bootstrap.lisp
   190â†’- [ ] T075 [US5] Handle :constructor option for custom constructor names in build/bootstrap.lisp
   191â†’- [ ] T076 [US5] Add defstruct expansion to expand-form-recursive in build/bootstrap.lisp
   192â†’- [ ] T077 [US5] Remove defstruct from *skip-expansion-ops* in build/bootstrap.lisp
   193â†’- [ ] T078 [US5] Verify all US5 tests PASS (green phase)
   194â†’- [ ] T079 [US5] Run wasm-tools validate on output with defstruct forms
   195â†’
   196â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 5 complete - defstruct expansion works independently
   197â†’
   198â†’---
   199â†’
   200â†’## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   201â†’
   202â†’**Purpose**: Integration testing, validation, and final verification
   203â†’
   204â†’- [ ] T080 [P] Write contract test for combined form compilation in tests/contract/stage0-extend-test.lisp
   205â†’- [ ] T081 [P] Write integration test for 50%+ compilation rate in tests/integration/stage0-compile-rate-test.lisp
   206â†’- [ ] T082 Run full bootstrap and verify compilation rate â‰¥ 50% (427+ of 849 forms)
   207â†’- [ ] T083 Run wasm-tools validate on final dist/clysm-stage0.wasm
   208â†’- [ ] T084 Verify error report shows operator-grouped statistics
   209â†’- [ ] T085 Update CLAUDE.md with Feature 038 completion summary
   210â†’- [ ] T086 Run nix flake check to verify all tests pass
   211â†’
   212â†’---
   213â†’
   214â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   215â†’
   216â†’### Phase Dependencies
   217â†’
   218â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   219â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   220â†’- **User Stories (Phase 3-7)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
   221â†’  - US1 (P1) â†’ US2 (P2) â†’ US3 (P2) â†’ US4 (P3) â†’ US5 (P3) in priority order
   222â†’  - OR multiple user stories can proceed in parallel if staffed
   223â†’- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete
   224â†’
   225â†’### User Story Dependencies
   226â†’
   227â†’- **User Story 1 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on other stories
   228â†’- **User Story 2 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1
   229â†’- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1/US2
   230â†’- **User Story 4 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1-3
   231â†’- **User Story 5 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1-4
   232â†’
   233â†’### Within Each User Story
   234â†’
   235â†’- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
   236â†’- AST changes before compilation changes
   237â†’- Core implementation before integration
   238â†’- Wasm validation after implementation
   239â†’
   240â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   241â†’
   242â†’- All Setup tasks T002-T005 marked [P] can run in parallel
   243â†’- All test tasks within each story marked [P] can run in parallel
   244â†’- Different user stories can be worked on in parallel by different team members
   245â†’- Once Foundational phase completes, all 5 user stories can start in parallel
   246â†’
   247â†’---
   248â†’
   249â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   250â†’
   251â†’```bash
   252â†’# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together (TDD - write first):
   253â†’Task: "[US1] Write unit test for ast-defconstant struct creation in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
   254â†’Task: "[US1] Write unit test for parse-defconstant-form in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
   255â†’Task: "[US1] Write unit test for simple defconstant with literal value in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
   256â†’Task: "[US1] Write unit test for defconstant with arithmetic expression in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
   257â†’Task: "[US1] Write unit test for defconstant referencing another constant in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
   258â†’Task: "[US1] Write unit test for defparameter mutable global in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
   259â†’```
   260â†’
   261â†’---
   262â†’
   263â†’## Implementation Strategy
   264â†’
   265â†’### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)
   266â†’
   267â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   268â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   269â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (defconstant/defparameter)
   270â†’4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Run bootstrap, verify defconstant forms compile
   271â†’5. Measure compilation rate improvement
   272â†’
   273â†’### Incremental Delivery
   274â†’
   275â†’1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
   276â†’2. Add User Story 1 â†’ Test independently â†’ Compilation rate improves
   277â†’3. Add User Story 2 â†’ Test independently â†’ More conditions compile
   278â†’4. Add User Story 3 â†’ Test independently â†’ More functions compile
   279â†’5. Add User Story 4 â†’ Test independently â†’ Better error visibility
   280â†’6. Add User Story 5 â†’ Test independently â†’ More structs compile
   281â†’7. Each story adds value without breaking previous stories
   282â†’
   283â†’### Target Metrics
   284â†’
   285â†’| After Story | Expected Forms | Expected Rate |
   286â†’|-------------|----------------|---------------|
   287â†’| US1 (defconstant) | ~100 | ~12% |
   288â†’| US2 (define-condition) | ~120 | ~14% |
   289â†’| US3 (declare) | ~300 | ~35% |
   290â†’| US5 (defstruct) | ~350 | ~41% |
   291â†’| All combined | ~450 | ~53% |
   292â†’
   293â†’---
   294â†’
   295â†’## Notes
   296â†’
   297â†’- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   298â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   299â†’- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
   300â†’- TDD is REQUIRED: Write tests FIRST, verify they FAIL, then implement
   301â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   302â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
   303â†’- Run wasm-tools validate after each user story
   304â†’- Final target: â‰¥50% compilation rate (SC-001)
   305â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Stage 0 Capability Extension

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/038-stage0-extend/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: TDD is REQUIRED per Constitution Check (Principle VII). Tests MUST be written first and FAIL before implementation.

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions

- **Single project**: `src/`, `tests/`, `build/` at repository root
- Paths use absolute paths from repository root

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and shared test infrastructure

- [ ] T001 Create test directory structure for new tests in tests/unit/, tests/contract/, tests/integration/
- [ ] T002 [P] Add test file stubs for defconstant-test.lisp in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T003 [P] Add test file stubs for declare-skip-test.lisp in tests/unit/declare-skip-test.lisp
- [ ] T004 [P] Add test file stubs for defstruct-expand-test.lisp in tests/unit/defstruct-expand-test.lisp
- [ ] T005 [P] Add test file stub for stage0-extend-test.lisp in tests/contract/stage0-extend-test.lisp
- [ ] T006 Verify test runner can load all new test files via (asdf:test-system :clysm)

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**âš ï¸ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T007 Add constant-registry hash-table initialization to build/bootstrap.lisp
- [ ] T008 Implement register-constant function in build/bootstrap.lisp
- [ ] T009 Implement lookup-constant function in build/bootstrap.lisp
- [ ] T010 Implement constant-defined-p function in build/bootstrap.lisp
- [ ] T011 Add defconstant to compilable-form-p acceptance list in build/bootstrap.lisp
- [ ] T012 Export new AST symbols (ast-defconstant, filter-declare-forms) from src/clysm/package.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Compile Constant Definitions (Priority: P1) ğŸ¯ MVP

**Goal**: defconstant and defparameter forms compile to Wasm globals with constant folding

**Independent Test**: Compile `(defconstant +test+ 42)` and verify Wasm output contains a global with value 42

### Tests for User Story 1 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)

- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Write unit test for ast-defconstant struct creation in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Write unit test for parse-defconstant-form in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T015 [P] [US1] Write unit test for simple defconstant with literal value in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T016 [P] [US1] Write unit test for defconstant with arithmetic expression in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T017 [P] [US1] Write unit test for defconstant referencing another constant in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T018 [P] [US1] Write unit test for defparameter mutable global in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp
- [ ] T019 [US1] Verify all US1 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T020 [US1] Add ast-defconstant struct definition (mirroring ast-defparameter) in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T021 [US1] Add parse-defconstant-form function in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T022 [US1] Add defconstant case to parse-form dispatcher in src/clysm/compiler/ast.lisp
- [ ] T023 [US1] Implement fold-constant-expression for arithmetic (+, -, *, /) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T024 [US1] Implement fold-constant-expression for constant references in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T025 [US1] Implement compile-defconstant (immutable global) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T026 [US1] Add defconstant case to compile-form dispatcher in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T027 [US1] Verify all US1 tests PASS (green phase)
- [ ] T028 [US1] Run wasm-tools validate on output with defconstant forms

**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - defconstant/defparameter compilation works independently

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Compile Condition Definitions (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: define-condition forms expand to defclass and compile successfully

**Independent Test**: Compile `(define-condition my-error (error) ())` and verify defclass output

### Tests for User Story 2 (TDD - Write FIRST, ensure FAIL)

- [ ] T029 [P] [US2] Write unit test for expand-define-condition basic case in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
- [ ] T030 [P] [US2] Write unit test for define-condition with slots in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
- [ ] T031 [P] [US2] Write unit test for define-condition with :report option (skipped) in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
- [ ] T032 [P] [US2] Write unit test for nested condition inheritance in tests/unit/condition-expand-test.lisp
- [ ] T033 [US2] Verify all US2 tests FAIL before implementation (red phase)

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T034 [US2] Implement expand-define-condition function in build/bootstrap.lisp
- [ ] T035 [US2] Handle slot specifications with :initarg and :reader options in build/bootstrap.lisp

## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Integration testing, validation, and final verification

- [ ] T080 [P] Write contract test for combined form compilation in tests/contract/stage0-extend-test.lisp
- [ ] T081 [P] Write integration test for 50%+ compilation rate in tests/integration/stage0-compile-rate-test.lisp
- [ ] T082 Run full bootstrap and verify compilation rate â‰¥ 50% (427+ of 849 forms)
- [ ] T083 Run wasm-tools validate on final dist/clysm-stage0.wasm
- [ ] T084 Verify error report shows operator-grouped statistics
- [ ] T085 Update CLAUDE.md with Feature 038 completion summary
- [ ] T086 Run nix flake check to verify all tests pass

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Stories (Phase 3-7)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
  - US1 (P1) â†’ US2 (P2) â†’ US3 (P2) â†’ US4 (P3) â†’ US5 (P3) in priority order
  - OR multiple user stories can proceed in parallel if staffed
- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

- **User Story 1 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on other stories
- **User Story 2 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1
- **User Story 3 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1/US2
- **User Story 4 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1-3
- **User Story 5 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on US1-4

### Within Each User Story

- Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD)
- AST changes before compilation changes
- Core implementation before integration
- Wasm validation after implementation

### Parallel Opportunities

- All Setup tasks T002-T005 marked [P] can run in parallel
- All test tasks within each story marked [P] can run in parallel
- Different user stories can be worked on in parallel by different team members
- Once Foundational phase completes, all 5 user stories can start in parallel

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together (TDD - write first):
Task: "[US1] Write unit test for ast-defconstant struct creation in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
Task: "[US1] Write unit test for parse-defconstant-form in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
Task: "[US1] Write unit test for simple defconstant with literal value in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
Task: "[US1] Write unit test for defconstant with arithmetic expression in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
Task: "[US1] Write unit test for defconstant referencing another constant in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
Task: "[US1] Write unit test for defparameter mutable global in tests/unit/defconstant-test.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (defconstant/defparameter)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Run bootstrap, verify defconstant forms compile
5. Measure compilation rate improvement

### Incremental Delivery

1. Complete Setup + Foundational â†’ Foundation ready
2. Add User Story 1 â†’ Test independently â†’ Compilation rate improves
3. Add User Story 2 â†’ Test independently â†’ More conditions compile
4. Add User Story 3 â†’ Test independently â†’ More functions compile
5. Add User Story 4 â†’ Test independently â†’ Better error visibility
6. Add User Story 5 â†’ Test independently â†’ More structs compile
7. Each story adds value without breaking previous stories

### Target Metrics

| After Story | Expected Forms | Expected Rate |
|-------------|----------------|---------------|
| US1 (defconstant) | ~100 | ~12% |
| US2 (define-condition) | ~120 | ~14% |
| US3 (declare) | ~300 | ~35% |
| US5 (defstruct) | ~350 | ~41% |
| All combined | ~450 | ~53% |

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- TDD is REQUIRED: Write tests FIRST, verify they FAIL, then implement
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
- Run wasm-tools validate after each user story
- Final target: â‰¥50% compilation rate (SC-001)
